content: Lifestyle PFF Panel 4 PFF Panel 1 Seedly PFF 2019 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Mar 2019Assuming u are truly financially independent at 62 yrs old, what would u do on a daily basis in SG? It seems boring to retire in SG...4 answersAnswerBump0

I found meaning in life through giving, so probably I would involve myself with activities that allows me to give, Be  my knowledge, experience or even fund to the less fortunate.0 comments1

Loo Cheng Chuan, Founder at 1M65 MovementLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 05 Mar 2019Continue to work! Retirement does not mean stop working, but it can mean working in a job or area that you love and money is not the issue.  Most successful entrepreneurs and people continue to work in areas they love till their 80s or 90s....0 comments0

Dawn FionaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 03 Mar 2019Do what you love! Eg. write a book, spend your time volunteering, hanging out with family or your grandchildren, travel the world, etc. The possibilities are endless when you don't have to worry about having enough money to pay the bills :)0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Mar 2019You can continue to work but maybe part time instead. Volunteer work, overseas trip and so on. Or just enjoy retirement overseas.0 comments0
